title: [Bug]: Waiting for network...
body:
### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA?

No

### Describe the bug

When opening teams, is does not manage to connect. The app window stays white and the taskbar reads "Waiting for network". 

### What package are you using?

deb

And am currently on the latest version of teams-for-linux (2.0.12) (installed via `apt`). To see if I can get teams working I tried the appimages for a few more versions (teams-for-linux-2.0.11.AppImage, teams-for-linux-2.0.10.AppImage, teams-for-linux-1.13.2.AppImage). The debug output is from `teams-for-linux-1.13.2.AppImage`:

```bash
$ uname -a
Linux xxxx 6.1.0-34-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.135-1 (2025-04-25) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

### Version

1.13.2, 2.0.12, ...

### Reproduction steps

Start the app.
The issue occurs in different networks and also after restarting.

### Debug

#### Version 1.13.2 (AppImage)
```bash
$ ./Downloads/teams-for-linux-1.13.2.AppImage --webDebug --logConfig='{}'
No config file found, using default values
all good with appLogLevels you aren't using them
```
